alert.note: Alert for Adams; Blackford; Grant; Jay; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 6:01AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Grant, Blackford, southern Wells, southern Adams and Jay Counties through 630 AM EST... At 600 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Redkey to near Hartford City to near Upland to 6 miles west of Swayzee. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Dunkirk and Redkey around 605 AM EST. Hartford City around 610 AM EST. Portland and Pennville around 615 AM EST. Marion and Montpelier around 620 AM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Geneva and Van Buren. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 253 and 271. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
